title: MOC3D- Three-dimensional method-of-characteristics ground-water flow and transport model integrated with MODFLOW-96
subTitle: Three-dimensional method-of-characteristics ground-water flow and transport model integrated with MODFLOW-96
summary: This model simulates three-dimensional solute transport in flowing ground water. The model computes changes in concentration of a single dissolved chemical constituent over time that are caused by advective transport, hydrodynamic dispersion (including both mechanical dispersion and diffusion), mixing (or dilution) from fluid sources, and mathematically simple chemical reactions (including linear sorption, which is represented by a retardation factor, and decay). The model can also simulate ground-water age transport and the effects of double porosity and zero-order growth/loss.
body: This model simulates three-dimensional solute transport in flowing ground water. The model computes changes in concentration of a single dissolved chemical constituent over time that are caused by advective transport, hydrodynamic dispersion (including both mechanical dispersion and diffusion), mixing (or dilution) from fluid sources, and mathematically simple chemical reactions (including linear sorption, which is represented by a retardation factor, and decay). The model can also simulate ground-water age transport and the effects of double porosity and zero-order growth/loss.
